name: Super Bomba Patch
description:
Bomba Patch is a series of modifications (mods) of the Pro Evolution Soccer video game series, created by the Brazilian Allan Jefferson. It originated in 2007 from a championship of the sixth title in the series, organized by the same in his video store. For the championship, he decided to exchange the original soccer teams for Brazilian teams. Eventually, the mod, named after chocolate eclairs, became known nationally.

Allan stopped working at Bomba Patch in 2008 when he moved to study at a university. However, later realizing the great popularity of the game, added to a store sponsorship, he returned to update it frequently. Since then, several versions of the mod have been created, and Allan has created social networks for it. Several publications recognize Bomba Patch as one of the main and most popular sports mods in Brazil.
